intro: Pentopetia androsaemifolia subsp. multiflora, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and its stems are hairy and somewhat woody at the base. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. This species is valued in gardens for its ornamental flowers and ability to attract pollinators.
